thread.title: Ducks, Beavers helmet decals among athletic program tributes to victims of Oregon school shooting
thread.title_full: Ducks, Beavers helmet decals among athletic program tributes to victims of Oregon school shooting | OregonLive.com

author: Danny Moran | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Ducks, Beavers helmet decals among athletic program tributes to victims of Oregon school shooting
text:
The athletic programs at the University of Oregon and Oregon State University each planned a series of tributes to the victims of Thursday's mass shooting at Umpqua Community College in Roseburg.
Both football teams announced Friday that they will wear matching helmet decals, which feature a black ribbon and the letters "UCC" across the middle. Oregon will play at Colorado on Saturday at 7 p.m. but Oregon senior associate athletic director Craig Pitens said in an email he was not sure if the decals would arrive in time for kickoff due to Hurricane Joaquin.
If the decals do arrive in time Saturday, Pitens wrote that Colorado also plans to wear them. He did not specify from where the decals were shipping.
Oregon State's football team has no game this week. The Beavers will next play at Arizona on Oct. 10 and plan to wear the decals for the remainder of the 2015 season.
Unified for UCC pic.twitter.com/I0l4qQ8son
— Beavers Football (@OSUBeaversFB) October 2, 2015 Zack Lassiter, a deputy athletic director at Oregon State, said both schools began working on similar helmet decal tributes independently Thursday before getting in contact that night and coordinating the effort.
Lassiter said Oregon State had moment of silence at Friday's men's and women's home soccer games and plans for the same at Friday night's home volleyball game against Utah. He also said the athletic department is in discussion for more extensive tributes prior to Oregon State's next home football game against Colorado on Oct. 24.
"We've got a lot of things to work on between now and then," Lassiter said.
Oregon State's fall athletic teams plan to wear the "UCC" ribbons on their uniforms for the remainder of their respective seasons, according to Lassiter.
The University of Oregon painted the black UCC ribbon on Papé Field prior to the Ducks' women's soccer match against Colorado at 7 p.m.
Great hustle by our staff to have the UCC ribbon placed on Pape Field for tonight's @OregonSoccer match. pic.twitter.com/odnl90Tedr
— Craig Pintens (@UOPintens) October 2, 2015 -- Danny Moran
dmoran@oregonian.com
@DannyJMoran
